results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: Bronze boy
results.creator_credit: David Sims, David H. Fowler, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 228 of Series “Parade”.
A step-by-step record of the creation in 1969 of a life-sized statue of “Young Nick”, a cabin boy on Captain Cook’s ship “Endeavour”. The sculptor, Auckland’s Frank Szirmay, speaks about his work.

results.title: Advanced panel beating and paint work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Panel & paint”.
Provides instructions for the serious amateur panel beater. Demonstrates advanced techniques beyond basic repairs including correct methods for replacing door skins and quarter panels and windscreen fitting. Outlines two pack paint application discussing mixing, spray equipment and safety concerns. Features John Llewellyn.

results.title: Specialist panel work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Panel & paint”.
Provides instructions in advanced panel beating. Lessons include, lead wiping, metal finishing, shrinking, welding and rust removal.

results.title: Panel beating and paint work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Panel & paint”.
Provides instructions for the serious amateur panel beater. Introduces the essential tools, rust treatment, paint preparation and minor body repairs. Professional advice and demonstrations are given, leading step by step to the perfect job.

results.title: The Texture of light: The Astronomer (1668) Johannes Vermeer
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Les Films d'Ici, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
A detailed look at Vermeer’s painting “The Astronomer” and its companion piece “The Geographer” in the context of the entire body of Vermeer’s work, which is not large. These extraordinarily detailed portraits, all apparently set in the same interior, show a photographic vision, aided perhaps by the use of the camera obscura, and an acute awareness of the properties of light. Explores Vermeer’s technique and the possible symbolism of the paintings’ props.
results.title_for_label: The Texture of light: The Astronomer (1668) Johannes Vermeer

results.title: The Mirror of paradoxes: self-portraits, Rembrandt Van Rijn
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Musée du Louvre, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
Rembrandt created almost one hundred self-portraits from the age of twenty to the age of sixty-three. This program looks at a selection of these in detail, discussing his technique, how it differed from others’ painting at the same time, at some of the possible symbolism of the costumes and props he used and at outside influences on his art. An American version of a French production.
results.title_for_label: The Mirror of paradoxes: self-portraits, Rembrandt Van Rijn
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Musée du Louvre, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
